body.p:
Newport Ky.
April 18th 1864
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette
I assisted the regular Attorney for the Commonwealth in the prosecution of Patrick White & Philip Kennedy at the February Term 1862 of the Campbell Circuit Court, under indictment for Rape.

The conviction, in my judgment was right, but considering the doubtful character of the prosecuting witness Elizabeth Franklin, for chastity, I am satisfied that had the law allowed the jury would not have given them a longer time than they have already suffered imprisonment.
I therefore recommend that the Executive clemency be extended to Kennedy, as I understand it has already been extended to White.

Very Respectfully
James R. Hallam
Attorney at Law.
